chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jacob W. Konstanski was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs, blood draw fee and DNA surcharge within 60 days (4/25/16) through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office or set up a payment plan within said time.
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.

timeConds.notes:
in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence on or before today, 2/24/16 by 6:00 p.m.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Jacob W. Konstanski in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews right to an attorney, court reviews charges and penalties, defendant appears w/out attorney, lost attorney elgibility through SPD, defendant pleads no contest, court finds plea made FVKI, court accepts plea, ct. 2 is dismissed, ct. 3 is DRI, bac was .269, state heard, defendant makes statement, court heard and sentence imposed.  Atty Thompson heard on bail, court defers that issue, gives Atty Thompson has 10 days to respond to bond issue.

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Jacob W. Konstanski in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advised by SPD that defendant is no longer eligible for SPD. Discussion held. Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel. Court reviews rights. Defendant wishes to take plea offer, come back for P&S date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant, Jacob W. Konstanski in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Mr. Konstanski no longer qualifies for public defender.  Discussion held on whether he would proceed without counsel.  Atty. Thompson heard.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 20 days mtns; stc set; bail con't.  Review hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 08:15 am.  TSC set 3/11/16 at 8:30 am.
